name: Grilled Hawaiian Chicken and Pineapple Sandwiches
author: FoodieGeek
summary: Marinated, grilled chicken is topped with grilled pineapple and cheese. It may sound a little strange, but it is very tasty!
ingredients: 6  skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - pounded to 1/4 inch thickness
directions: Place the chicken pieces into a large resealable bag and pour in the marinade
Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour or up to overnight
Preheat a grill for medium-high heat
When hot, lightly oil the grate
Remove the chicken from the marinade and discard the marinade
Grill the chicken pieces until cooked through, about 10 minutes, turning once
5 minutes before they are done, place the pineapple rings on the grill and cook for a couple of minutes per side
Place the pineapple slices on top of the pieces of chicken and top with a slice of cheese
Close the lid to the grill and allow the cheese to melt for a minute
To assemble the sandwiches, place the chicken, pineapple and cheese onto the bottom buns
Spread the thousand island dressing onto the top buns and place onto the sandwiches
